intro: Eremostachys jakkabaghi, commonly known as the Persian sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Eremostachys jakkabaghi is well-suited to rocky and sandy soils, making it a hardy species for xerophytic gardens.
